videos.title: Glenwood 2023 Pre-race recon
videos.description: Are you racing The Glenwood Gravel Grinder this weekend and want to get the inside track on course features and conditions? Have you not signed up yet and need that last little nudge to get you to register? Look no further. All the nitty gritty details are right here at your fingertips. ENJOY!
videos.transcript:
we
[Music]
2023 edition of the Glenwood gravel
grinder just days away we wanted to do a
deep dive into the course and conditions
and give you an idea of what to expect
on race day Glenwood Iowa population
5073 is nestled amongst the lowest Hills
in Mills County
just on the east side of the Missouri
River Glenwood is located in a hollow
that's surrounded by undulating terrain
and makes for a picture-perfect day of
riding the race starts at Glenwood park
just off of Highway 80 and makes its way
into the Glenwood archaeological State
preserve the course is front and heavy
in terms of elevation with about half of
the climbing taking place within the
first 25 miles miles 3 4 and 5 all
feature a pitchy incline in the six to
eight percent range
these initial inclines will take you on
to some of the best bee roads in Western
Iowa be ready for dirt and possibly even
a little mud
as you continue South at Mile 5 you'll
encounter one more gravel pitch that
will take you to Kidd Road and we'll see
the elevation even out a little bit
enjoy this three mile rolling respite as
you approach The Descent leading to
Nagle Avenue you'll be moving fast on a
double track B Road and at Mile 10
you'll arrive at one of the most
prominent features of the Glenwood
gravel course pathfield Road
with its towering sidewalls path field
is a sight to behold you'll experience
both a fast ascent and a challenging
climb in this picturesque portion of the
Los Hills the latter portion of which
features a nearly 14 grade
the final section of path field evens
out and gives you an opportunity to take
in the scenery from a lovely Hillside
you'll encounter a one mile climb as you
turn left onto Quant Road at nearly 13
miles in and a thousand feet of climbing
logged fatigue will be taking its toll
the final section of Quant at a 10
incline
will definitely sting a bit
however there will be spectators at the
top awaiting your arrival
at mile 15 you'll have an opportunity to
let off the gas a bit as you head south
and descend to Plum Creek Road and some
fast Farm Road action
if you've ever wanted to ride your bike
as fast as you can through a cornfield
this is your big chance
this segment known as Farm Road from
hell can be a dream or a nightmare
depending on how dry or wet the path is
mile 21 will give you an opportunity to
collect your breath just ahead of one of
the last climbs before a more forgiving
10 miles of flat and fast this will take
you through to the town of Thurman and
alongside some distinctive Rock
outcroppings if there was a villain of
the Glenwood gravel grinder it would be
quick clocking in at just over a mile
and Topping out at nearly 11 incline
this climb will be a key factor in
determining the front group for the last
third of the race at about mile 48
you'll encounter Rally Road now it's no
coincidence that we don't have any
footage of this descent this is without
question the most technical sector of
the course with bike tire size ruts and
a stunning negative 14 grade at the
start this would be the perfect time to
remember the old Axiom go slow to go
fast
if you can manage to push your tired
legs for the next 13 miles you'll be
rewarded with relatively flat rolling
terrain and even some forgiving pavement
then two final climbs followed by a
descent to the Finish
Glenwood is actually one of the faster
races in the Iowa gravel series with
last year's winner clocking in at 3
hours and 17 minutes in Aborigine just
over 19 miles per hour and that's
considering that last year's course
conditions were well
challenging
if you haven't already registered for
this weekend's event there's still time
head over to bikeredge.com and look for
Glenwood gravel and finish your 2023
gravel season in the beautiful Los Hills
of Iowa hope to see you there

videos.title: 2020 Glenwood Gravel Preview
videos.description:
We took the opportunity of the long weekend to preview the course for the first ever Glenwood Gravel Grinder. The dirt roads have been freshly graded, there was plenty of sun, and just a slight wind from the South. Made for a perfect day to ride and we hope we get something similar on Sept. 19th for the 2020 ride.
Here are the stats:
- Distance: 51 miles
- Elevation: 2,900ft of climbing
